options: Any closed path through a circuit
A loop that contains no other loops inside it
A branch with a current source
questions.correctAnswer: A loop that contains no other loops inside it
questions.explanation: A mesh is the smallest loop—a loop that contains no other loops inside it. It's like a 'window' in the circuit.
questions.prompt: What is a mesh in circuit analysis?

options: Meshes can only be defined in circuits drawable without crossing wires
It's just a convention, mesh analysis works anywhere
questions.correctAnswer: Meshes can only be defined in circuits drawable without crossing wires
questions.explanation: Mesh analysis requires identifying inner loops (meshes). This is only possible when the circuit can be drawn flat without crossing wires—the definition of a planar circuit.
questions.prompt: Why does mesh analysis only work for planar circuits?

options: Sum of all resistances in the circuit
Sum of resistances in mesh k
questions.correctAnswer: Sum of resistances in mesh k
questions.explanation: R_kk is the sum of all resistances in mesh k. It represents the total resistance 'seen' by mesh current i_k.
questions.prompt: In the resistance matrix R, what does the diagonal entry R_kk represent?
